programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Sunday evening belongs to the Braves and Mets as the NL East rivals complete a three-game series. Atlanta's Bryce Elder (1-1, 5.28 ERA) won both starts against New York last season, allowing just six hits while striking out 11 Mets in 11 1/3 innings.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Pacers host the Knicks for Game 4 of their East semifinal, down 2-1 in the series. Indiana defended home court with a back-and-forth 111-106 decision in Game 3. Tyrese Haliburton (IND) matched Donte DiVincenzo's (NY) game-high with 35 points.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee brings his humor and candor to the microphone to highlight the day's top stories.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: In-depth, comprehensive daily coverage of all aspects of the NBA from expert analysts.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: The Hurricanes visit the Rangers for Game 5 of this Eastern Conference semifinal. Carolina lived to see another day with a 4-3 triumph in Game 4. Former New York defenseman Brady Skjei (CAR) scored the winning goal with under four minutes to play.

programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: The Avalanche look to tie up their West semifinal series against the Stars as they play Game 4. Dallas goaltender Jake Oettinger made 28 saves in the 4-1 Game 3 victory over Colorado. Tyler Seguin and Logan Stankoven each scored twice for the Stars.

programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: The Panthers try to oust the Bruins in Game 5 of their East semifinal. Florida took a 3-1 series lead with a 3-2 victory. Sam Bennett, whose hit in Game 3 knocked Boston captain Brad Marchand out of the lineup, scored a controversial goal in Game 4.

programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: The Oilers try to level their series with the Canucks as they host Game 4 of this Western semifinal. Brock Boeser and Elias Lindholm each scored a pair and Arturs Silovs made 42 stops as Vancouver held off Edmonton 4-3 in Game 3 to take a 2-1 edge.

programme.title: Full Court Press
programme.desc: Discussing the latest news and events in the worlds of professional and amateur hoops.

programme.title: Full Court Press
programme.desc: At the close of the regular season, Kiki Rice begins embracing her confidence and growing leadership of the UCLA Bruins. All eyes are on Caitlin Clark's record-breaking performances, while Kamilla Cardoso receives a heartwarming surprise.

programme.title: Full Court Press
programme.desc: As top seeds in the tournament, Iowa and South Carolina aim to return to the Final Four. After the season, Kiki Rice focuses on the future with UCLA while Caitlin Clark and Kamilla Cardoso take center stage at the WNBA Draft.

programme.title: WNBA Basketball
programme.desc: Caitlin Clark makes her much-anticipated professional debut as her Fever visit the Sun. Clark was selected by Indiana with the first pick in the draft April 15 after a decorated career at Iowa, where she became the NCAA's all-time scoring leader.

programme.title: WNBA Countdown
programme.desc: WNBA news, analysis, highlights and interviews.

programme.title: WNBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Aces begin the quest for a third straight championship with a home date against the Mercury. Las Vegas took out New York in four games to win the 2023 title, with A'ja Wilson named Finals MVP. Phoenix hired a new head coach in Nate Tibbetts.

The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Unsportsmanlike with Evan, Canty and Michelle
programme.desc: Start the day off right with Chris Canty, Evan Cohen and Michelle Smallmon providing an energizing and informative way to take on the day. Sports, life and laughter are what it's all about.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: Pre-Draft Camps: NBA Draft Combine 2024
programme.desc: Some of the college basketball players expecting to be picked at the upcoming NBA Draft work out, are measured and take medical tests for scouts and other team personnel.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: In-depth, comprehensive daily coverage of all aspects of the NBA from expert analysts.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: The Point
programme.desc: ESPN's flagship hockey show featuring highlights, news, analysis, speed, skill and access to the biggest stars, stories and personalities of the game. Hosted by John Buccigross.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: Action from the PBA bowling tour.

programme.title: The Masters Agility Championship at Westminster
programme.desc: The top agility dogs in the world compete for the title at Westminster.

programme.title: United Football League
programme.desc: The Stallions (6-0) host A.J. McCarron and the Battlehawks (5-1) in a showdown of division leaders. McCarron, who played parts of seven NFL seasons with the Bengals, Raiders and Texans, has passed for 1,306 yards and a UFL-best 13 touchdown tosses.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: The NASCAR Cup Series moves to Darlington Raceway for the Goodyear 400. Kyle Larson benefited from the closest finish in Cup Series history on May 5, capturing his 25th victory by 0.001 seconds over Chris Buescher at the AdventHealth 400 in Kansas.

programme.title: NASCAR Xfinity Racing Series
programme.desc: NASCAR Xfinity Series competitors head to South Carolina for the Crown Royal Purple Bag Project 200. Since switching to the No. 20 car for Joe Gibbs Racing, Ryan Truex has finishes of seventh, 34th and a win at the BetRivers 200, his second at Dover.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series
programme.desc: The Lady in Black hosts the NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series for the Buckle Up South Carolina 200 at Darlington Raceway. Series points leader Corey Heim earned his second win of 2024 at Kansas on May 4. Christian Eckes took the checkered flag last year.

programme.title: The Carton Show
programme.desc: Craig Carton, one of New York's best-known voices, analyzes and debates the biggest headlines in sports each morning.

programme.title: Undisputed
programme.desc: A daily sports talk show hosted by Skip Bayless, where each day Skip is joined by a cast of NFL legends for passionate conversations about the biggest sports topics of the day.

programme.title: The Herd With Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Colin Cowherd and co-host Jason McIntyre break down the biggest stories and interview the biggest guests in sports.

programme.title: First Things First
programme.desc: Nick Wright, Chris Broussard and Kevin Wildes explore and energetically advance the biggest stories in sports.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: Emmanuel Acho, Joy Taylor, and LeSean McCoy bring a fun, passionate, smart, and energetic discussion to the biggest sports topics of the day.

programme.title: NASCAR Race Hub
programme.desc: Highlights, news, opinion, and a heavy dose of unexpected fun from the always-rocking world of NASCAR.

programme.desc: A preview of the Westminster Dog Show.

programme.title: Inside the NBA
programme.desc: This Emmy Award-winning studio show, which airs following each NBA telecast on TNT, is hosted by Ernie Johnson, with analysis from Hall of Famer Charles Barkley and NBA champions Kenny Smith and Shaquille O'Neal. It's a mix of highlights, interviews and hijinks, notably the verbal sparring sessions between the outspoken Barkley and his straight man, Smith. The show also welcomes various guest analysts throughout the season.
